topics: Review of financial modeling and numerical analysis

assignments.description: At least five individual homework assignments
assignments.details: You have 5 'late days' over the semester. Beyond that, late homework will not be accepted.

policies.late_work: You have 5 'late days' over the semester. Beyond that, late homework will not be accepted.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Familiarity with a programming language such as Matlab, R, or Python.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: Provide students with understanding of essential computational tools used by quantitative analysts in the financial industry.
learning_outcomes: Understanding of essential computational tools used by quantitative analysts in the financial industry.
Ability to apply these tools to forecasting, asset pricing, hedging, risk management, and other financial applications.
prerequisites: Stochastic calculus at the level of FE543/FE610.
